11232.content:
You lay curled in your bed, snug in your baby blue pyjamas, staring at the ceiling of your bedroom. Thunder occasionally roars loudly outside, and countless drops of rain slam loudly against the roof. Even though it was midnight, you couldn’t get a moment of sleep no matter how hard you tried. You couldn’t shake the feeling that you weren’t alone -- that something was watching you.

Your eyes scan your tiny bedroom, occasionally illuminated by the strikes of lightning, before coming to rest on your closet. You realized that, while the rest of your room was decently lit, your closet was completely, impossibly dark. Anything could be waiting in that darkness, staring back at you, invisible, waiting to strike when you least expect it.

You squeeze your eyes shut, trying to expel the thoughts from your mind. Your heart skips a beat when you look again and see large, glowing red eyes staring back at you from the darkness.

“I brought cookies!”

The sudden booming voice from your closet almost caused you jump out of your skin. “Whoa!” you yell, startled. “Don’t scare me like that, Kasadya!”

A tall, sylphlike figure emerged from your closet, stepping into the light. You recognized her easily. Nobody else you knew had a body like that. “Hehe! Sorry!” she giggled, flashing a cheerful, but ominously toothy smile.

Your visitor resembled an huge anthropomorphic bat, but with a few monstrous features, such as intimidating horns and a long forked tail. She was just less than 15 feet tall, being over three times your height. Being a monster, she was always both supernaturally voluptuous -- with pillowy breasts that were bigger than your head -- and naked, though her long purple fur did provide her some modesty.

You see, in the remote city in which you lived, parents would often scare disobedient children with the tale of the Kindĕk.

The Kindĕk, or so the legend goes, was a large anthro woman, tall enough to swallow a normal human whole. Most of the time, the Kindĕk was invisible, and would watch over the younglings of the city. When she found an obedient, innocent child, she would leave them gifts, or grant wishes for them. When she found someone nasty and corrupted, she would pester and haunt them and, if they don’t change their ways, eventually devour them.

Well, you’ve met this legendary ‘Kindĕk’, and in reality, her name is actually Kasadya, and she was a total sweetheart. She may be a monster, but she was also one of the only friends you’ve ever had. Before you met her, you assumed she was just a fake myth made to scare kids into obeying their parents, but as it turns out, the myth was completely true.

When you were very young, Kasadya seemed to take special interest in you for some reason. You would often find gifts mysteriously appearing in your room, and other strange ‘coincidences’. After you lost your parents, her sympathy for you increased, and she ended up revealing herself to you and offering you one wish. One wish for anything in the world.

You wished for her to be your pet, and from then on, she had always been by your side.

Kasadya picked your tiny body up easily, and you blushed as she wrapped you in a warm hug. Since you are a third her size, she is far stronger than you are. “Where have you been?” you ask as she hugs you against her chest. “You haven’t visited in three months!” Kasadya didn’t want her existence to be discovered, so she could only visit you late at night, when everyone else was sleeping.

“I’m sorry, pumpkin. I’ve just been sooo busy,” she frowned, as she set you back on the floor. “Children are just so disobedient nowadays! Smoking, cursing, bullying…”

She pulls out a plate of cookies she brought with her. “But I can make it up to you. Here - chocolate chip cookies, hot out of the oven!” she smiled, offering you as many as you like. Most of the food you got to eat in your day-to-day life was slop, so Kasadya knew how much you appreciated treats like this.

“Are you sure these are safe?” You say, staring incredulously at the snacks. “You remember what happened last time you tried baking something.”

“Yep! I didn’t even use a recipe from the necronomicon this time,” she insists. “Just a regular, non-evil cookbook. Here, try one!”

You realize that it must’ve been extremely difficult for her to bake these cookies given her large size, so you shrug and accept her gift. You hesitantly chomp down one of the cookies, only to be pleasantly surprised. “Hm! These are pretty good!” you say, reaching for another.

She giggles as you chow down, sitting down next to you on the bed, your small bed creaking beneath her butt. “So how have you been doing while I’ve been gone?” she asks.

You think back on the past few months with grief. You’ve been treated poorly by your guardians and peers, but even worse has been the crushing loneliness. “I don’t want to talk about it…” you say, your sadness apparent in your voice. “I just wish you didn’t have to leave all the time.”

“Awww,” she frowns, again. She pulls you closer to her until you’re nestled comfortably against her furry side, and she ruffles your hair, watching you eat with a motherly smile on her face. “I know, pumpkin. It must get pretty lonely around here.”

“I know you’re really busy these days,” you ask. “But could you stay here for a few days before you leave again? Like… a week, maybe?”

She looks at you, blankly, considering it silently for a few moments. “A whole week? I don’t know if I can…” she says. “I’d fall way behind schedule, and it’s been awhile since I’ve ate. I’d probably get really hungry.”

Kasadya isn’t the only ‘monster’ in the world. In fact, there’s hundreds of them -- hiding across the globe, making sure their existence isn’t discovered by society. Their abilities and traits vary wildly, but they all share a few features; they’re all anthropomorphic women of varying shapes and sizes, they all have magical abilities, and they all have a peculiar diet consisting entirely of human kids. In folklore, they are commonly referred to as ‘boogeymen’, as if somehow designed to scare children into behaving.

Luckily, Kasadya only has to eat every month or so, so it’s usually not that big an inconvenience. It was now, though. “Please!” you ask, giving her a cute, pleading look. “You can eat while you’re here! I don't mind!”

“Well… okay. As your pet, if you want me to stay, I guess I’m honor-bound to stay,” she relented, and then giggled, “and besides, I can’t say no to that face.”

“Yay!” you cheered, jumping up and hugging her, even though she was far too tall for you to wrap your arms around her.

Kasadya was staying over for a whole week! During the day, she had to stay invisible, so nobody would notice her. But at night, when everyone else was sleeping, you and her stayed up having fun until the wee hours of the morning, as long as you didn’t make too much noise. Even though your time with her was limited, it was always great having her over -- she was your only real friend, after all.

What do you want to do on your first night together?

11331.content:
Just how on Earth did humans come to preside over anthros in the first place? After all, anthros range anywhere from 5 to 50 times taller than the average human, so you think they’d be the ones in control. It’s a good question - one anthropologists have been debating for centuries. Just the fact that humans still exist at all is a miracle. There were plenty of other intelligent species that were around human size, but they all went extinct long ago, devoured by the massive anthros. So why did the human race survive? Well, it’s simple - they’re not very tasty.

So how did humans manage to not only befriend anthros, but rule over them? Knowing humans, you might assume that the answer was through warfare - that they might’ve dominated the anthros using explosives and fire. In reality, though, humans came to become the dominant species through diplomacy! You see, anthros have BIG appetites, and humans were the only species to master agriculture, allowing them to grow enough crops to keep the anthros well-fed. Once anthros are well-fed, they’re docile, so the anthros quickly allowed themselves to be tamed.

Or, at least, that’s what this textbook you’re reading says. Living deep in the labyrinthian alleyways of New Fluff, reading was one of your only hobbies, and you always enjoyed pouring through the books your feline companions brought for you, in exchange for your ‘services’...

But, perhaps I’m getting ahead of myself…

Allow me to explain. Have you ever heard of a ‘feral child’? Someone who’s taken in and raised by animals, instead of humans? Well, you’re sort of one of those. When you were born you were abandoned by your mother, left to - you shudder to think- die in an alleyway in the rain. Luckily, one of the local alleycats just so happened to hear you crying… and ended up bringing you to a community of cats just like her. They were all ‘strays’ - anthros who have been abandoned by their owners’ - and thus, they sympathized with your plight.

Ever since then, these alleyways have been your home, and the local strays have been raising you like one of their own. They’ve given you the human name of ‘Joseph’, although you also go by a nickname, ‘Catnip’. You don’t really speak to your fellow humans much, preferring the company of your feline companions… speaking of which, from the massive footsteps growing louder, you can tell one of them is approaching!

“Good mornin’, Catnip!” The lid of the little cardboard box you were resting in was pulled over, and a massive, smiling, feline face loomed over you. You chuckled as you started up into her massive, excitable, golden feline eyes. You’d recognize those eyes anywhere.

“Morning, Vivian!” You waved, only to giggle a bit, startled, when she reaches into the box and grabs you by the shirt collar, lifting you up in the air. Vivian was an egyptian mau, with beautiful white fur with light gray patterns. Like the other strays, she was, of course, completely naked, although her long, silk-like fur lent her some modesty. Like the other cats, she was about 50 feet tall, meaning she could easily carry you in the palm of her hand. “What’s with the rush?”

“Oh, I don’t need ya for anything, myself! One of the other cats jus’ wanted me to come fetch ya,” she giggled as she walked, carefully holding you in her hand. A sultry, teasing look dawned on her face as she continued. “She said it was an ‘emergency’.” You smile a bit, excited. An ‘emergency’... you know what that means!

You see, one of the other ways in which humans befriended anthros was by showing their usefulness as, well… ‘toys’. After all, humans are small enough to fit into all sorts of nooks and crannies, and the resulting sensations can be mind blowing, or so you’ve been told. Well, recently, in exchange for all of the hard work they’ve done for you, you’ve started offering these sorts of… ‘services’ to the alley cats you live with. Yeah… let’s just say you’ve come to know all of them on a very deep, intimate level.

Vivian was probably your favorite. She was always so gentle, always listening to what you had to say and trying to make it fun for you.

Then, there was Bianca and Serena - a maine coon and a norwegian forest cat, respectively, who were madly in love with eachother, and often asked for your help ‘spicing up’ their sex life.

Then, there was Jeanette, who was a little… rough around the edges. She was the domineering type, being a little forceful and loving to squeeze down around you, trying to show you who’s in charge. Though, deep down, you knew she had a softer side.

Then there was Fleur, a chausie with beautiful dyed fur. She rarely requested your help, considering she already knew plenty of anthros boys around town who were all eager to satisfy her every desire. But, when you’re lucky, she’s occasionally in the mood to toy with a human. In those times, you’re always blown away by just how… hypnotic and seductive she is.

Last but not least, there was Rosalind, a savannah cat who was, apparently, abused by her previous owner, and doesn’t seem to trust humans. Thus, she only requests your help when she’s in heat, and even in those times, you have to be very careful and gentle with her. You honestly feel sorry for her, sometimes…

Regardless, as Vivian navigates the winding alleyways, you soon see who you’ll be serving today!

You step onto Jazz's hand carefully, making your way to the center of her outstretched paw. Once that you make it to the center you lie down against her thumb. After making sure that you are comfortable enough, Jazz begins lowering her other paw on top of you, so you'll be safe on the journey home, in case Jazz bumps against another anthro. Once that she is certain that you are secure, she begins raising her paws slowly until you are next to her chest.

"I'm so excited! My first home!" She says while walking out of the alley and out into the street. "No more sleeping on the cold ground or being wet while trying to get out of the rain, and this is all because of you!"

She begins purring at the thought of a warm bed, bringing you up from time to time to cuddle against her cheek.

On the way home...
114122211.title: Adopt her! You can make room for her, and you...

choices: You make it towards your place, without incident.
1141222112.content:
The thought just hit you. Where will Jazz sleep? While you have a house big enough for Jazz, you don't have a bed made for anthros, or any other kind of supplies such as food or shampoo made specially for cats. Not wanting to disappoint Jazz when she arrives home without any place for her to sleep other than the ground, you decide that the best course of action isn't going straight for home, but to make a quick stop (Or maybe a long stop, depending how many things you need to make Jazz's stay comfortable). So, you decide to change course before you arrive home.

Looking at Jazz, you say to her "Hey, Jazz. I was thinking of making a quick stop somewhere else before heading home. I have to buy a few things. Would you mind taking me there?"

"Sure thing! A few more minutes out here won't make a big difference and I'm used to it." She says, while she stops looking around her. "Which way?"

"Oh, it's a few blocks down that way. We should be there in a couple of minutes" You tell her, trying not to reveal to much since this might be a pleasant surprise for her.

On the way to the store, you decide to ask her something: "¿So you have never had a place to call home in your entire life?". Without looking at you, she says in a solemn voice "Well, not really. I was born somewhere in the city, on the streets. I can't remember much, of where, but I do remember that my mom took care of me most of my life in the alley that I met you."

Now that she mentioned her mom, you wonder why she wasn't with Jazz back at the alley when that anthro dog captured you, but you decide it might be a bad topic for conversation having just met Jazz. Besides, you don't want to ruin Jazz's mood. She seems so happy about finally having a home and you can even see her smiling every time she turns her gaze to you.

Once that you see the pet store coming up, you tap Jazz's thumb and ask her to stop.

You notice Jazz looking a bit confused, looking around for another store. "Are you sure we are there yet? I don't see another shop besides the pet store."

While Jazz is looking at you for answers, you make a big grin. That's enough to send a loud and clear message to Jazz about your intentions of bringing her here.

"You must be joking!" She says, with and incredulous look on her face. "We just met, and you want to buy me stuff? You are the best human ever!"
She brings you up to her face and starts licking you for what seems like hours. Once that she is finished, you are soaked in her saliva. She starts looking at you with a kind of loving gaze once that she finishes.

“Well, how about we head inside? I’ll let you choose whatever bed you want.” You say to her. “But make sure to also choose some clothes. We can’t have you walking around with only your fur coverings now, can we?”

She chuckles at your last remark and starts making her way inside with a quick pace. You can see her face and see a hint of glee.
Once inside, you both marvel at the size of the store. There must a million things for pets inside of this store. There’s hundreds of categories for pet supplies, with different species in mind and a massive selection of clothing for each species.

Jazz sets you down on the ground and starts darting from stand to stand, marveling at each item selection made for cats. You can hear her “Oohs!” and “Ahs!” every time she sees something she likes. Once that you get to the bed aisle, you can see Jazz’s expression suddenly change. She looks like she is about to cry.

“Is everything alright, Jazz?” You say. Once that she hears this, she wipes away a tear and says “Oh, I’m actually so happy. It just reminded me of sleeping on the ground, on a piece of cardboard all the time. And now, I’m actually going to sleep in a bed for the first time. It’s amazing to think about it!”.

You chuckle out loud. “That’s true. Just make sure you choose a bed that you like. Don’t worry about me.” You say to her.

Once that she has chosen her bed, some clothes, a sofa for anthros and supplies, you make your way to the cashier. It looks like the cashier is an anthro Iguana with a human sitting on her shoulder. Once that we make our way there, she smiles at us and asks if that’s all.
“Well, we don’t have a way to transport the bed and the sofa to my home right now. Do you have a transport service or something like that to help us out?” You ask her.

Smiling at you, she says “Of course, sir!” while she passes out a form “If you fill your address here, we will transport your furniture to your home. If you live close by, we might even be able to take the furniture there tonight since we don’t have anything else that requires transport services right now!”

Once that you fill the form, Jazz picks you up again and holds you on her paws. You begin to notice how soft her paws are with all the fur, even if Jazz seems to be a bit dirty at the moment. You also notice some little scars on the exposed skin of her palms. Looks like she lived a rough life back in the alley.

As you head outside, Jazz brings you to her chest and gives you a hug. You can feel her breasts on either side of you. You notice that they are big, even for anthro standards, but you quickly banish the thought. Once outside, you give directions to Jazz towards your home and she begins moving with a slow pace, savoring every moment while hugging you and purring with content.

On the way home…
1141222112.title: To the pet shop!

choices: "I want you to give me a tour of the entire house!"
11412221122.content:
You continue giving Jazz directions to your home, while she follows your directions, giddy to finally have a place to call home. You can feel her heart rate accelerate as you tell her that you are close to your home, clearly showing how excited she is.

When you arrive outside your home, Jazz is marveled at how huge your house is. She has a huge grin on her face, almost like she is contemplating all the fun times she is going to have in her new home. It's a good thing that the previous owner had anthros living with him, so Jazz should be able to accommodate easily to her new home.

When you get to the doorstep, the door is easily 50 feet tall, enough to accommodate Jazz's height. You then take your keys out of your pocket and signal Jazz to put you down so you can open the "side door" which is made for humans. Once inside, you press a button next to the huge door to unlock it and let Jazz inside. Once unlocked, the door almost instantly opens and Jazz comes running inside all excited with glee showing on her face.

After looking around the main hallway, she runs back to you and picks you up, hugging you to her chest. You can hear and feel her purr happily. You kinda feel like she is acting a bit like a little kitten, although a huge one at that. You feel that the hug lasts for an half an hour, but it actually only lasted for a couple of minutes. Once that she stops hugging you, she brings you to her face and starts licking you over and over again. You can feel her tongue all over your face. It kind of feels raspy, but at the same time it feel kind of nice.

Once she is done, you are dripping with drool. When she sees this, she starts giggling and apologizes.

"So, what would you like to do next?" You ask Jazz, staring her at her eyes.

To which she replies...
11412221122.title: You make it towards your place, without incident.

114122211221.content:
“Alright. Follow me then and I’ll show you my home.” You pause for a second and look back at her with a smile. “Sorry. OUR home!” You giggle, stroking Jasmine’s thumb as you sit there looking at her face. She is looking at you wide, with her eyes already welling up from all the excitement and joy that she has had during the day. She brings you to her lips and instead of licking you again, she gives you a kiss on your head. They literally cover your entire head, her lips molding around it. You can feel her warm flesh it transfers some of it’s hit to you as it makes contact, as well as a damp feeling, as her lips are somewhat wet from her saliva. You feel light sucking as she puckers her lips, before she pulls you away from the kiss. You are speechless, unable come up with words to communicate what you feel. As you look at her, she is looking at you with care. You see her lips moving saying a silent “Thank you”, before she lowers you down to her shoulder. You hop off and sit down, grabbing strands of her fur for support and for balance.

You let out a little ahem, breaking out the awkward moment, before speaking. “So… Let’s start with the living room, shall we?” you said, pointing at the room lying in front of both of you. “As you can see, it’s a pretty cozy place. It has a fireplace to keep me warm during the winters, a flat screen TV and a sofa, which turns into a bed in case there are any guests staying over.” You say, sounding like a sales agent. Before you continue, Jazz interrupts you by holding a hand in front of you, like if she had a question. “Yes?” You ask, a bit curious about her question.

“Well, it’s all beautiful looking and all, but I don’t see anything of what you are speaking of. The room is empty.” She says, a bit perplexed. You laugh, pointing at a little corner of the living room where said things were, done for your size. “Ooooooooh” she let’s out, realization dawning upon her as she lets out a soft giggle. “Remember, I’m living on my own inside a house made for giant anthros. Why get giant stuff if I’m living on my own.” You say, shrugging at the situation. Jasmine walks over to the tiny set of furniture lying on the corner and crouches down, inspecting the TV and the couch. “It’s cute!” she giggles.

“I’m glad that you think so, but we aren’t done with the tour yet. Onwards!” you yell, as you buckle and point towards the kitchen. She lets out another giggle, before walking over there. To her surprise, the kitchen was fully equipped for her size. “The previous owner thought that it would be too much trouble to take everything from here with him, so he only took the fridge and the microwave with him.” You tell her, as she walks around the kitchen, marveling at the cabinets and at the remaining kitchen appliances. “Of course, we will have to live without a fridge for you for awhile. In the meantime, we will have to make do with Cans of food and what not. I hope that you like tuna!” You tell her, a bit worried that she might not feel welcome without fresh food. To your surprise, she is quite happy. “Oh, of course I love tuna! I always had to scavenge from trash piles, so this is quite the improvement for me!” She says with joy in her voice, as she gives you a tiny peck on the top of her head.

You continue showing her the rest of the house, including the guest room where she will be staying and your room. As you finish the tour of the house, you hear the bell ringing. Someone is at the door. You head over there with Jasmine and peak over the window. It’s the pet store helpers’, bringing all the things that you bought over in a giant truck made from anthros. Jasmine giddily open the door and sets you on her palm, as you are handed some documents that need your signature. As soon as that’s done, Jasmine steps aside as a couple anthro dogs walk in, carrying inside what you had bought at the store, making multiple trips between your home and the truck. As soon as they are done, a tiny human sitting on one of the anthros shoulders waves goodbye and they depart.

Jasmine closes the door, and immediately runs over to the new sofa and jumps in, you still in her hand. The world spins around you, as gravity shifts from side to side, until she finally lands. You are a bit disoriented, but before you know it, Jasmine is licking you again, purring all the while. This was one happy kitty.

After awhile of chatting and getting to know each other better, you let out a loud yawn. She follows suit, stretching and yawning. “Well, it’s getting late. I better let you sleep. It has been a long day!” You tell her, before you motion her to let you down. Before she does, she brings you up to her face, and looks at you with pleading eyes. “I… know that you have done a lot for me, and I shouldn’t be asking for more after all you have given me, but… could you sleep just this night with me?” She pauses a bit, before bringing you closer to her face. “It’s just, since it’s my new home, and I have known that alley I was for many years, I might feel a bit lonely…” Before she continues, you cut her off, waving with your hand and smiling. “There’s no need for explanations. I’ll be happy to sleep tonight with you, Jazz!” As you say this, she brings you down to her chest for a hug. Softness and warmth surrounds you, as both her flesh and fur brush against you. She doesn’t stop hugging you, and instead begins walking to her room with you trapped between her chest and her arms.

As she arrives to the foot of her new bed, she flops down face up against the bed. Her body bounces a bit as she settles. She opens her arms, revealing your tiny figure cradled between her huge orbs. You wiggle out and stand between her chest. “Alright, then. Goodnight Jazz!” You say, as you turn around to jump off her body and onto the mattress. Before you do, she pins you down with one hand and snuggles you to her cleavage. “Where do you think you are going? I never said you’d sleep on the bed, silly.” She says, with a sly grin on her face, showing off one of her fangs. You blush, of course, surprised at her sudden request. Well, not a request, more of a command. You smile shyly, before speaking “I… Are you sure? I… don’t want you to feel uncomfortable.”
“Of course not! I was the one that made the request, remember? Now lie down and enjoy.” She says, her voice soft. You can feel and hear her purr, content to have you there with her. She brings a hand up and setting it on you, covering your head and torso. As you lay there, you are glad that you made the decision and adopted her. This was truly going to be an interesting start to both of your new lives.

You soon fall asleep, both from her purring and one of her fingers patting your head.

11412222.content:
Before the dog furry can make a choice, though, you hear a young man shouting nearby. You and the dog furry look to its source, and see a young man about your age approaching, waving his hands. The dog furry holding you takes a few steps towards the young man, but he holds up a hand for her to stop.
"Who's that, girl?" he asks, pointing at you.

"My human!" she says, holding you out in front of herself. You look over your shoulder at the man on the ground some distance away from and below you, and shrug as best you can. Seeing as your arms are currently pinned in the soft, yet tight, grip of this dog furry, you can't really make the gesture too well.

The man sighs and tells the dog furry to put you down. She follows the order, looking at you sadly as she walks over to the man. The man apologizes to you, then continues walking down the sidewalk, the dog furry following him.

You shake your head. It's a shame some people can't control their pets. Even if all the pets around here are many times the size of humans, they're almost always trained extensively to be obedient, by owners or breeders. Apparently, sometimes young furries just forget their training.

You wonder what to do next. You could continue on your way back home, but you really want to know who the owner of that voice in the alley was.
You decide to check the alley. Walking into it again, you see a giant shape moving in the shadows. It stops when you approach, and you decide to speak.
"Hey," you say. "Who are you? Are you the one that tried to get the dog furry to release me?"

Out of the shadows comes an interesting sight. A cat furry, but very dirty-looking--a stray, by your guess. She has matted black fur and dull green eyes, with black and unkempt hair on her head. She's crouching, and has her hand-paws on the ground. She apparently has no clothes, but her hair is long enough to cover her chest, and she seems to constantly keep her tail wrapped around herself and covering her privates. She stops approaching you when she's about twenty feet away, and you can approximate her height as being 40 feet or so.

"Y-yes... I spoke up..." she stammers.

You frown. Something is definitely wrong with this furry. She seems so afraid... "Is something wrong? Why are you so scared?"

She takes a deep breath before replying. "Well... You see..."

Fast-forwarding to after class- an ideal place for making new narrative!
114221.content:
"Master." A firm nudge on your back. Large, soft, firm. One of her fingers. Please, no, not yet...
"Mmmm," You mutter in disapproval. Another prod.
"Master, it's time to wake up."
"Mmmm!" You mumble louder.
"Master Keith, I'm sorry, but if you don't get up now, you'll be late for your Anthro-History class." With that, you feel a strong force pull your warm covering off of you- she's taken your blankets.
Uuuuuugh.
You rise to greet the world around you, another Monday, another week of tedious classes to go. You yawn and rub the sleep from your eyes as Tundra stares at you intently with her piercing blue gaze. You got her when she was still a young puppy at eight years old, ten years ago, and the husky still somehow beat you to maturity. Tch. Anthros. Still, at least her eyes stayed beautiful.
You pick your clothes out of your closet and get into the shower for another day of classes at Hamilton Grove University, pulling the screen around your living space. You don't know why you bothered; Tundra could and would sneak a peek over your curtain that 'partitioned' your space from hers whenever she felt like it, at fifty feet tall. (Forty-nine and nine inches, but whatever.) Speaking of which...
"Tundra..." You call out warningly, feeling her icy azure gaze wandering over to you.
"I'm not looking, Master," She called out in a sing-song voice, happily munching on some eggs and bacon she had on her own over-sized table. Suuure she wasn't. At times like this you wistfully juggled the idea of getting a solo dorm room for yourself, but you know it'll never happen. The rooms were expensive enough as it is at a college just getting one for yourself, and you certainly didn't have the budget for both Tundra and yourself to get perfect privacy. The human-only dorms were really only reserved for visitors, the especially rich, or those who didn't have any anthro partners of their own and could forego the expense of an anthro room- but in this day and age, who ever heard of not having an anthro beside them?
So, you were stuck with some miniscule living quarters built almost as an after-thought into the not-so-miniscule living quarters of your own pet husky. She was living better than you were. Anthros.
You towel yourself off and brush your teeth, but you've barely picked up your pants before Tundra chimes in, "The stick, Master Keith!"
"Oh, right," You call out. You'd almost forgotten your deodorant. You grab your Old Spice stick and run it over you a few times before getting dressed. It's only after you finished pulling the shirt over your head that you feel the sudden tension of excited expectation in the air. You only get to cry out as you're grabbed under the armpits, hoisted thirty-five feet in the air, and felt a moist, spongy feeling envelop your back. An instant later-
SHNNNNNNNNNNNFFFFFF!
"TUNDRA!" you yell, trying to look behind you in her grip.
"Sorry, Keith, it's just... you smell so good with that deodorant on," she says with a contented smile. Her pointed ears are especially perky, you can tell.
Anthros.
"Well, come on, Tundra, you know where classes are," You sigh. She would carry you to yours before going to her own. Your book bag in her paw and her own on her back, she cradled you like an infant and opened her own door to the outside. It was embarrassing to be in this pose, but it was ultimately the most efficient way of transport you'd found with her so far.
Besides, you thought as you looked up to Tundra, cradled in the warm, soft, black-and white furs of a giant you considered a sister, a daughter, and a friend all at once... all the complaining said and done, this life was a pretty good one.
But you'd never tell Tundra that!

1143122.content:
You made the trudge you've been dreading for some time. You had to go check out your family's dilapidated old 'summer home' (a cute name for a house your father bought, intending to flip it, but then he broke his leg... and then the car needed new tires, winter storms, and so on and so forth).

It belonged to an elderly couple who had sold it to your dad before moving into a nursing home. It was a quaint 'little' cottage on the outskirts of the town. Stones and gravel kicked at your car as you approached the house. You and your dad were worried that with all the winter storms that hit, that perhaps there was structural/roof damage done. And since Dad was still in a cast, this task was left to you.

The door's lock opened after a few tries, the light from outside cascading along the front hallway. It was then that you smelled it... that... dusty... musty... 'sawdust' kind of odor. Your thoughts first went to worried about the water pipes, perhaps they had burst? You stalked down the hall into the living room, and that's when you first see it... the back porch door had been knocked down and the screen door torn apart.

Jeezus... had someone broke into the house? That thought crossed your mind as you approached the back of the house. Then you noticed... some feathers... lotsa feathers actually... covering the floor... going in the direction (if your memory was still correct) of the master bedroom. You carefully picked one of these up... and noticed it was quite the large feather.

You now wished you had a crow bar, a tire iron, or even a BIG STICK on you as you slowly walked down the hall leading to said bedroom. There were scratches along the wall, and the door looked like it had seen better days as you peeked your head into the room...

You almost mistook it for a large pile of leaves gathered on the lonely mattress... until you realized those were feathers as you slowly crept into the room. It was a large creature of some kind. A bird of some sort... but you were having trouble making out what it was in the dim light of the room.

You got about ten feet from the bed... when these large eyes opened up... and you realized what it was.

An Owl!

It quickly started to stir as you immediately... automatically started backing up. The creature stood to it's full height, spreading it wings as it did.

It was then that you realized...

1143122231.content:
Kinda hard not to realize this... what it's rather massive BREASTS resting on your face as you two laid there... on the feather-strewn floor. She must've been one of those 'Anthros' you heard about on the news. You rarely saw much of them in your neck of the woods... at least... you thought so... until now.

Would explain why there was a twelve-to-fifteen foot OWL in this house.

"Dammit!" muttered the bird as she tried to get up off the ground. You got a closer look at the aforementioned wing while she attempted this. It had a deep gash on it, that was barely 'scabbing' over and from the looks of things... it hurt. The leg didn't help things either.

Carefully, not wanting to startle her... you slid up from the ground. Gently, you moved under where her 'shoulder' was and helped the giant anthro Owl stand up. Startled, she almost flopped backwards onto the bed mattress. "What're you doing?!" she hissed, pushing you away from her.
"You're hurt... and needed help." you replied.
"I'm... I'm fine!" she snaps, cautiously moving away from you. "What's it to you?!"

"Well... my family kinda owns this house... so... unexpected guests are definitely going to be a concern." you replied.
"What happened to Ertha and Jim?" inquired the Owl as she folded her wings over her body.
"They sold the house to my dad... and moved to a nursing home." you replied. The expression of the Owl turned more somber as she sat on the bed.
"Really? They were such nice people." mumbled the avian forlornly. "They used to let me stay in the garage during winter. Or, if it was REALLY cold... the living room."

"They did?" you replied with a question. "Why'd they never mention it to us?" The owl simply shrugged.
"Those wounds need some attention." you say, turning towards the door. "I got a kit in my car... I'll be right back." The big bird simply watched you go without a word.

By the time you got back in the house with the first-aid kit, the owl was trying to limp it's way out the back door. You rushed to her side. "What the hell are you doing?!" you asked.
"Don't need help!" she snapped... right before falling on her side.
"I beg to differ!" you shout as you open the kit, pulling out bandages, gauze and peroxide.
"LEAVE ME ALONE!!" screeches the Owl as she tries to get up.

"NO!" you reply as you get near her wounded wing. You wetted some gauze with the peroxide and applied it to the cut on her wing. If she wasn't screeching before... the large big was SHRIEKING now from the new burning pain. She immediately threw you off herself, slamming you onto the carpet five feet away.
"You need some help! You're in no condition to leave!" you growl as you get back up, determined to help this silly creature. She gasped as you returned to her wounded appendage.

"Stop! That Hurt!" she whimpered trying to push you off again.
"That's because you're already wounded!" you counter as you apply more peroxide to it, causing the big busty owl to screech again.

You braced yourself for the expected follow-up... before...

"FINE!! Finish it up then!!" gasped and whined the Owl as she started to sob. Concerned, you started to apply more peroxide to her wing, this time she merely winced and moaned from the pain. Content that you had successfully (at least to your limited skills) cleaned the wound, you went about bandaging up the wing. The Owl merely sat there as you worked.

"Why not just a normal doctor? I'm not some sick cat!" she guffawed.

Sighing you pulled your phone out of your pocket and dialed 9-1-1. It took a minute to explain the situation, but you were pretty sure they understood what was going on and sent some doctors to come help.

"They should be here within the hour." you announced as you tried to think of what to do for her until then. "Name's Markus by the way."
"Kiriya." she replied, blushing as she tried not to make eye contact with you. "Why... why are you helping me?" she asked.
"Do I need a reason?" you replied. "Yeah you broke in... but you're injured... and need help. What more is there to know?" you asked Kiriya. She sulked.
"Just not used to trusting people... outside of Ertha and Jim." chirps Kiriya "Especially when they to sneak up on me"

The two of you chuckle as you wait for help. As you waited... you...

You are Samantha, an average young woman in her early twenties, living with her average parents in their average neighborhood with your pets, a family of Austrian Pinschers, a medium sized breed of about 30 feet tall at most. There is Helen (32), the mother and therapy dog who works around town tending to people in need which helps when she’s 25 feet tall. She can be very motherly to people she loves and being so big, it's easy for her to do so. Then there’s Tyler (16), her eldest son and winner of a few athletic competitions and the biggest of the bunch at 30 feet tall. He can be really competitive, especially with his brother, but knows when to hold back. Finally, there’s Cody (9), an energetic and sweet pup of about 20 feet tall who’s, unfortunately for the family, has started to get urges as all pups his age do. Helen had shaggy tan hair and mossy green eyes, with white fur running from her forehead down to her groin, with white on her finger and toes and on the tip of her tail. The rest of her fur was a rusty red. Her sons definitely took after her in looks and personality, all of them being sweet and well behaved (most of the time).

It’s Friday, the first day of a four-day weekend but in your case, it’s a five day since you don’t have school on the day it’s over, so you have the entire house to you and your dogs.

Helen was in the living room, watching tv under her blanket. Going in there would mean you’d enjoy all her cuddling…

info.brief_description: An alternate universe where our pets are giant anthros.
info.description:
This is based on some old interactive story I contributed to which sadly for some reason no longer exists. Possibly because of the content with it being 13+ but this is 18+ so it doesn't matter.

This story is set in a parallel universe where pets are instead anthros who grow up to 30 50 feet tall. Houses are adjusted to massive sizes to accommodate for this.

Some small rules:
- The pets should be able to talk at some stage during the story, if not from the beginning.
- No graphic violence.
- Pets should at least initially act like pets. They do not own the humans.
- Sex and other explicit content is permitted.
- Sex with animals in this world is seen as perfectly normal and fine.
- NO killing off main character or in case of yourself, no killing your character either.
- Please have the chapters make sense.
- The pet will start off small (they can be held in your arms) but as they get older will quickly outgrow their owner.
- The pet will age in human years so to keep it all tidy.
- Exotic animals are perfectly fine as well
- Fictional animals (dragons, Pokemon, etc) are also OK.

UPDATE - 27/2/17 - There is no longer a height restriction on pets although they should compare realistically with other animals, for example a tiger should be much bigger than a dog.

Please add and have fun!
